fields.description:
Hello Team,

 

The customer is reporting a minor translation in Russian language version of Jira, on the popular filters section under:

 

 
{code:java}
secure/ManageFilters.jspa?filterView=popular{code}
 

 

The customer reported:

 

_Hello! You have a mistake in the Russian translation._
_On the Popular Filters page, you have the phrase "Эта страница показывает самые популырные фильтры."_
_The penultimate word needs to be corrected: "популярные"._

 

 

 

If I change the language on Jira I can see the same, however I don't know if the change should be made as I don't know the language, please check and correct if necessary.

 

!image-2021-10-15-11-21-17-714.png!

Regards.
fields.summary: Russian translation error

fields.description:
Problem statement:
The system fields like organization, request participants, request type has to be translated to Russian.
Checked that in the general system settings the default language is Russian, the browser language is Russian, the project default language is Russian however the system fields are still showing up in English.

Please refer to the attached screenshot
fields.summary: The system fields are not translated to Russian language

fields.description:
In the Confluence Cloud sign-up experience, users are asked to specify their first space's name. This field does not allow non-alphabetical(tested with Japanese) names, even though this is allowed in the actual space creation later-on.
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-11 at 12.02.01.png|thumbnail! 

This is confusing since this screen itself can be shown in other languages, even though though the field does not accept that language.
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-11 at 12.21.29.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to specify non-alphabetical space name upon Confluence sign-up

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a miss in Japanese for the message of 'Selection successfully moved'.
 Wrong(Current): 選択された課題 *がが* 移動されました  (が is duplicated)
 Should be: 選択された課題 が 移動されました
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change user profile to Japanese
 # Create a ticket in backlog
 # Create a sprint and make it active
 # Move the ticket to active sprint

h3. Expected Results

Correct message shows up : 選択された課題 *が* 移動されました
h3. Actual Results

Wrong message shows up : 選択された課題 *がが* 移動されました

!I18N-3453-wrong-message.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Wrong popup message in Japanese for 'Selection successfully moved'

fields.description: Please check the fields accordingly. The current translation means "prioritized incidents"
fields.summary: Wrong translation for Japanese

fields.description:
Hi.

An Epic in Jira is a noun.

In Danish, the noun for an Epic is "Epos"

The adjective "Epic" translates to "Episk"

In the translated Jira, an Epic is displayed as "Episk". It should be "Epos".

Here is the documentation for the word meanings (in Danish) from the official Dictionary:

[https://ordnet.dk/ddo/ordbog?query=Epos]

[https://ordnet.dk/ddo/ordbog?query=episk]

Please fix it :)
fields.summary: Jira term for "Epic" is wrongly translated into the adjective in stead of the noun

fields.description:
Original ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-77472

Translation issue on the french version.
When using the time tracker, the pop-up shows two closing buttons: "Save" and "Cancel".
On the french translation, "Cancel" should be translated as "Annuler" but is instead translated as "Annulé" (the equivalent of "Canceled").

Steps to Reproduce
Add the time tracker field to the field configuration and the issue screen
Create an issue and update the time tracking field.
"Cancel" should be translated as "Annuler" but is instead translated as "Annulé"
Expected Results
Cancel should be translated as "Annuler"

Actual Results
Cancel is translated as "Annulé"
fields.summary: Translation error on the french version when using Time Tracking Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? Please, create a clone for this ticket.
  {panel}

-----------
h3. Issue Summary
We are reporting a language translation error for *Portuguese(Brazil)* in the filter section *My open issues*, and in the sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your profile language to Portuguese (Brazil);
# Access *Filters > My open issues*;

h3. Expected Results
View the information with the correct translation.

h3. Actual Results
!Screen Shot 2021-09-29 at 4.36.17 PM.png|thumbnail!
!Screen Shot 2021-09-29 at 5.06.45 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
This correction must be done to *Meus itens abertos*, and *Itens abertos* according to the sidebar option.

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Filter MY OPEN ISSUES presents a translation error for Portuguese(Brazil)

fields.description:
When you click the plus sign to add an issue to an epic when Jira is in French, there's a typo (unun) where it should be "un"

 

!image-2021-09-16-15-30-35-591.png!

 

Fix was to change line 781 /jira-software-language-pack-fr_FR-8.15.0.20210809004541/com/pyxis/greenhopper/jira/actions/BoardAction_fr_FR.properties file from "gh.epic.create.issue=Cr\u00e9ez unun ticket dans l''epic" to "gh.epic.create.issue=Cr\u00e9ez un ticket dans l''epic"
fields.summary: French typo (unun) in the create issue in epic screeen title

fields.description:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-21869
h3. Issue Summary

On the Brazilian Portuguese Kanban board, the link to "Looking for an older issue?" contains translation errors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Jira on PT-BR language
 # Access a Kanban Board
 # Board settings must have
 Hide completed issues older than:
 1, 2 or 4 weeks.

h3. Expected Results

We should read:
 _Procurando um item mais antigo?_
h3. Actual Results

Reads:
 _Procurando uma item mais antiga?_

!image-2021-09-06-09-56-36-110.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently none.
fields.summary: Incorrect translation on PT-BR Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new space, a home page for it a created automatically. The page name should be ""Space Name" Home". Since Confluence 7.13.0 the name is ""Space Name"Главная"

Главная doesn't seem to be a good translation to home. It's better to keep it as home.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Put your Confluence Profile to Russian
 # Create a space named Testing

h3. Expected Results
Home page should name "Testing Home"

h3. Actual Results

The page is named "TestingГлавная" . Please note that space between the space name and Главная is missing
 !MainPage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Russian translation for space home page name is wrong

fields.description:
In about half of languages, we are seeing:
 * {{content-history.table.comment=Comment}}
 * {{content-history.table.contributors=Comment}}

And in the other half we are seeing:
 * {{content-history.table.comment=Comment}}
 * {{content-history.table.contributors=Changed By}}

The first version is wrong, the second version is correct.

*correct*:
 * da-DK
 * en-GB
 * en-US
 * en-ZZ
 * ja-JP
 * ko-KR
 * pt-PT
 * ro-RO
 * tr-TR
 * zh-CN
 * zh-TW

*broken*:
 * cs-CZ
 * es-ES
 * et-EE
 * fi-FI
 * fr-FR
 * hu-HU
 * no-NO
 * nl-NL
 * pl-PL
 * pt-BR
 * ru-RU
 * sk-SK
 * sv-SE
fields.summary: content-history.table.contributors incorrect for half of languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing the profile language to Portuguese makes Tuesday (Terça) show as Thursday (Quinta) and two Saturdays (Sábado) instead of Saturday and Sunday (Domingo) on the timeline view. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the profile language to Portuguese (Brasil).
 # Go to a JWM project and click on the Timeline (Cronograma).

h3. Expected Results

When changing the view to Weeks (Semanas), it will show Seg, Ter, Qua, Qui, Sex, Sáb, Dom.

!Screen Shot 2021-08-25 at 13.54.21.png|width=566,height=176!
h3. Actual Results

It shows Seg, Qui, Qua, Qui, Sex, Sáb, Sáb.

!Screen Shot 2021-08-25 at 13.51.20.png|width=853,height=205!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Days of the week not translated correctly on Timeline when using Portuguese (Brazil)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Chinese translation of Jira batched issue notifications is incomplete. Words "are", "comment", "comments", "update" and "updates" are not translated into Chinese in some parts of the batched issue notification email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure outgoing mail and batched issue notifications in Jira.
 # Set language to Chinese (中文 (中国)) on the user profile page in Jira.
 # Create a Jira issue with the user who has selected the Chinese (中文 (中国)) language on their user profile page.
 # Modify this issue and add a few comments to it. Such actions should trigger Jira to send a batched issue notification email.
 # The user should receive a batched notification email in Chinese.

h3. Expected Results
Email is properly translated to Chinese.

h3. Actual Results
Email is only partially translated to Chinese as shown on the screenshot below.
*  !email.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Please try this in a staging environment first and then proceed with introducing changes on production.
 # Navigate to "$JIRA-Installation-Dir/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/" directory.
 # Look for the "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar" file. Make a backup of it.
 # Copy the "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar" file into a separate folder and unpack it using the following command. You can also unpack it with the software you would use to unpack a compressed ZIP or TAR file.
{code}
jar xf jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar
{code}
 # Look for the "issue-update-batch-mail_zh_CN.properties" file. Open it with the text editor.
 # Replace the English words with the Chinese translation. (!) You can't simply input Chinese characters into this file. You must enter their Unicode codes. For example, you can use the Unicode code values provided in the "C/C++/Java source code" field on [this page|https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/search.htm]. Example: "[条|https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/6761/index.htm] [评|https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/8bc4/index.htm] [论|https://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/8bba/index.htm]" should be entered into the file as "\u6761\u8BC4\u8BBA".
 # After making all desired changes in the "issue-update-batch-mail_zh_CN.properties" file, please save it.
 # Copy all files unpacked from the "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar" (including the modified file) into the new directory named "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853".
 # Using the terminal, navigate to the newly created "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853" directory and execute the following command.
{code}
jar cf ../jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar *
{code}
 # The modified "jira-core-language-pack-zh_CN-8.15.0.20210614004853.jar" JAR file will be created. Upload it into Jira by going to *Jira Administration -> "Manage apps" tab -> "Manage apps" menu on the left* and selecting the "Upload app" link.
 # (!) All manual translation changes will need to be re-applied after each Jira upgrade.
fields.summary: Chinese translation of Jira batched issue notifications is incomplete

fields.description:
Add Welsh as a language for Trello.

 

All public bodies in Wales, such as universities and colleges, are not able to use a system that is not available in both English and Welsh.
fields.summary: Support Welsh in Trello

fields.description:
Jira iOS has a newish navigation tab called "Home" which is a place for users to easily find their latest work. So this is where their recent projects/boards/queues are made available. 

In Russia, this is translated to "Homepage" which is not exactly accurate, and customer also mentioned that it doesn't fit in navigation. 

Note for the new updated word: this is used in navigation tab title, so it needs to be short and clear one word. 

[https://customerfeedback.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/JNAFEED/queues/custom/211/JNAFEED-6178]

!image-2021-08-10-13-20-20-453.png!
fields.summary: "Home" on Jira iOS is translated to "Homepage" in Russian

fields.description:
The word "Problema" has a strong implication with a negative and specific thing. Any user using Portuguese (PT) browsing their project's side bar wonders why their project has any problems at all.

 

Since issues in Jira can take the form of many types of work, the work "Tarefa" would perhaps be more generic and easily associated with a wide array of processes.
fields.summary: Translating Issue to "Problema" is an inaccurate description

fields.description:
Wrong translation in Russian when starting new sprint and choosing its duration
Duration (Длительность) (ghx-sprint-duration)

*"2 недель(и"* should be *"2 недели"*
*"2 недель(и"* should be *"2 недели"*
*"2 недель(и"* should be *"2 недели"*
fields.summary: Russian translation of the word duration in sprint

fields.description:
The 1st column's width needs to be slightly wider for the multibyte characters; otherwise, it doesn't make any sense. Note: users cannot change the width of the "type" column.

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-30 at 12.32.00.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The "type" column needs to be wider for multibyte languages

fields.description:
Hello! I have discovered misleading translation. When I use my Jira in Czech, and go to Backlog, there is a meatball menu (...) and inside it is "Copy issue link". When I click it, it puts the URL of the issue to the clipboard so I can go somewhere else and paste it.

The thing is that this is translated as "Kopírovat propojení požadavku" which is how Czech Jira refers to "Issue links", such as "blocks" or "relates to". But this function is to copy issue URL, and not the "Issue link". The translation should say "Kopírovat odkaz na požadavek" or something similar. Perhaps "Kopírovat URL požadavku".
fields.summary: Misleading text in Czech

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The translation for "1 related article" in Dutch is incorrect and the word article is not translated
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have only 1 article related to an issue.
 # Change the profile language to "Dutch"

h3. Expected Results

The "1 related article" text in Knowledge base is correctly translated to "1 gerelateerde artikelen"
h3. Actual Results

It is translated to "1 gerelateerde _article_"

The word article is not translated. 
!Image 2021-07-26 at 1.57.00 PM.jpg|width=274,height=114!

Note: it is correctly translated if you have multiple _articles._
_!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/temporaryattachment/11d00d369ce5ac47169acb08841e6cf7cf906a09/temp17122690301137775165_Image%202021-07-16%20at%206.19.02%20PM.jpg|width=430,height=62!_

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect Dutch Translation for word "article" in Knowledge base field in issue view

fields.description:
Hi there,

I noticed a small translation error in Advanced Roadmaps with the translations of "Color by" from English to French.

The translation keys are 
 * *portfolio-3-portfolio.app-simple-plans.main.tabs.roadmap.view-settings.colour-by.colour-by-label*
 * 
*portfolio-3-portfolio.app-confluence-macro.main.legend.color-by-legend.color-by*

 
As you can see in the attached screenshots, "Color" has been translated as a noun in French, while it is actually a verb in this context. It would probably be safe to check if this label has been translated as a noun in other languages too.
Many thanks,

Quentin Feyaerts
Frontend Engineer of Advanced Roadmaps
fields.summary: Issue with the translation of "Color by" from English to French in Advanced Roadmaps

This is found in Hello. Please check the attached screenshot for the context.

fields.description:
Hi,

When saving an workflow the buttons for Publish and Discard in the Swedish translation is the same (Kassera utkast).

The button for Publish should be translated to Publicera.

Also the button for Discard should be translated to Kassera. The word utkast (draft) is not needed.

 

Regards,
Tobias
fields.summary: Same translation for different buttons in workflow (Swedish)

fields.description:
There is a warning message on the hierarchy page that says "You can't create a plan using next-gen projects as issue sources."

I've noticed that the German translation says "You can create ...", and had a quick check of a few other languages. Looks like it's mixed whether it says "You can" or "You can't" depending on the language.

"You can't ..." is the correct error message here.

--------

The page can be accessed here:
 # Navigate to the Jira Software admin panel using the  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/files/998650605/998650606/1/1585529107109/grey-cog.png|width=22!  icon in the upper right and select *Products*.

 # In the menu on the left, select *Advanced Roadmaps hierarchy configuration.*

**The translation files are in the Jira monolith repo:

{{jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-portfolio/portfolio-2/portfolio/portfolio-plugin/src/main/resources/portfolio-plugin/i18n/jpo-page-hierarchy.properties}}
fields.summary: Warning message on heirarchy configuration page says "You can" or "You can't" depending on language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a customer is invited by an agent or an admin they are sent to a registration screen that contains the following text: 
"Sie haben es fast geschafft. Wir benötigen nur noch ein Passwort, damit Sie sich später einloggen können."

This is an incorrect translation with words missing. 

Here is the correct sentence: 
"Schließen Sie die Einrichtung ihres Accounts ab. Dazu geben Sie bitte noch einen vollständigen Namen an und vergeben ein Passwort. Damit können Sie sich später jederzeit am Portal anmelden."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite Customer account unto a project 
 # Open the registration link from the received email on the customer account email on a browser that is set to German as a default language
 # See the badly translated text 

h3. Expected Results
We expect the translations to be correct

h3. Actual Results
Incorrect translation.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect German translation on customer registration screen

fields.description: "Customer sharing" is translated as "shared customer"
fields.summary: Mistranslation for "Customer sharing"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the german version of the invitation link for the registration from third customers is a issue with the german translation. In the e-mail the customers receives stands "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihr Registrierungsverknüpfung", but it must be "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihre Registrierungsverknüpfung".
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Tested in my test instance received the below email for registration :

Sie wurden in das ITSM-Portal eingeladen. Sie können dieses nutzen, um Anfragen zu stellen und Hilfe zu erhalten.
Um die Erstellung Ihres Kontos abzuschließen, klicken Sie einfach auf Ihr Registrierungsverknüpfung

 

Translation:
You have been invited to the ITSM portal. You can use this to make inquiries and get help.
To finish creating your account, simply click on your registration link.
h3. Expected Results

In the e-mail the customers receives stands "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihr Registrierungsverknüpfung", but it must be "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihre Registrierungsverknüpfung".
h3. Actual Results

It is showing wrong translation "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihr Registrierungsverknüpfung"
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation for "klicken Sie einfach auf Ihr Registrierungsverknüpfung" for portal registration

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-25 at 12.07.54.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-25 at 12.08.16.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Japanese translation in 6.15.9 is not really correct and can create confusion for users 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.15.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence in English
# Check the main Dashboard there is a tab called "Saved for later"
# Check any page you have access to, you will find a star menu called "Save for later" 
# Change your personal settings to 日本語(Japanese)
# Check the main Dashboard, the "Saved for later" tab is "お気に入り"
# Check any page you have access to, the "Save for later" button is "お気に入り"

h3. Expected Results
Using Japanese, we expect to see "Save for later" to be  "後で読む"

h3. Actual Results
"Save for later" button is "お気に入り" which is not a correct translation.

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-23 at 12.26.52.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2021-06-23 at 12.27.24.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Save for later" wrong translation in Japanese

fields.description: If other user changed language for himself to some other (for example to Spanish) and I have my Jira in English, when getting notification about status change of the ticket from that person, I get status of ticket in his language, instead of having it in my language
fields.summary: Language doesn't reflect local language

fields.description:
- "site admin" (site administration) is translated as "site administrator"

fields.description:
[https://jirastealth.dedagroup.it/issues/?filter=-1]

In Italian the filter, 'My open issues' is translated 
h1. Ticket non risolti segnalati da te

which is doing this query -

assignee = currentUser() AND resolution = Unresolved order by updated DESC

The translation literally means 'unresolved tickets opened by you', which our users reported is not correct, as we would expect from that description / title a list of issues where the current user is reporter. Therefore, in my opinion, the English is also at least confusing because to me, 'My open issues', would be a list of the issues I had opened, or where I am the Reporter.

For the query, assignee = currentUser() AND resolution = Unresolved order by updated DESC, I would have expected / anticipated a title more like, 'My work' or 'Issues assigned to me'.
fields.summary: My open issues Italian language translation and original English

fields.description:
Product: Automation for Jira

 

Audit log error message in Japanese is lacking information about issue deleted case.
 > , or the issue was deleted

===

EN: Actor does not have permission to view one or more issues, or the issue was deleted (please check permissions and issue security levels)
 !a4j-someerror-english.png|thumbnail!

JA: アクターにリストのすべての課題を表示する権限がありません（権限と課題のセキュリティレベルを確認してください）
 !a4j-someerror-japanese.png|thumbnail!

 

→ suggest: 対象の課題が削除されたか、または アクターにリストのすべての課題を表示する権限がありません（権限と課題のセキュリティレベルを確認してください）
fields.summary: (A4J) Audit log error message in Japanese is lacking information about issue deleted case.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
It seems the "日", which is the measure word we use for the dates, is breaking the format when the date is the 11th or later. 
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Since it is clear that the numbers here are representing the dates, it should be fine removing the "日"s from these translation. Would it be possible to do that?

fields.description:
In Jira, the following French translations are wrong:
* sd.project.template.itil.v2.custom.field.change.start.date.name (Change start date)
* sd.project.template.itil.v2.custom.field.change.completion.date.name (Change completion date)

They use the verb "change", when these strings are actually referring to the noun (i.e. _changement_ in French). The word here means an ITSM change (e.g. it is a change that is going to happen).

sd.project.template.itil.v2.custom.field.change.start.date.description and 
sd.project.template.itil.v2.custom.field.change.completion.date.description should also be checked to make sure that they're correct.
fields.summary: Incorrect French translation in Jira for "Change start date" and "Change completion date"

fields.description:
Hi team we have received this support ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76729?error=login_required&error_description=Login+required&state=3cb34020-1665-45b2-8566-bb7082d3855f   After checking the report it appears that in the monolith, for both the portuguese languages (possibly others?) the translation for this string: `jira-importer-plugin.documentation.hint` is incorrect eg there's weird html inside where most of the content should be the place holders.   Current is    jira-importer-plugin.documentation.hint=Voc\u00ea est\u00e1 prestes a iniciar a importa\u00e7\u00e3o do \{0}. Para saber mais sobre isso, consulte a nossa suas contas est\u00e3o inativas no Jira. Esses usu\u00e1rios precisam ser ativados para a importa\u00e7\u00e3o prosseguir.

Conceda aos \{1} usu\u00e1rios a seguir permiss\u00f5es globais de usu\u00e1rios do Jira antes de tentar importar novamente. It should be something like jira-importer-plugin.documentation.hint=Voc\u00ea est\u00e1 prestes a iniciar a importa\u00e7\u00e3o do \{0}. Para saber mais sobre isso, consulte a nossa ... \{0}. this breaks the html of the page and the upload csv functionality as well. Confirmed on this SS that fixing the translation will resolve some of the issues from the ticket
fields.summary: Portuguese Br/Pt translation error causing a bug on the csv import page

fields.description:
We've noticed in some languages other than English that our login/signup pages have inconsistent phrasing for "*Continue with* Google/Microsoft/Apple/Slack" as we've added more options over time.

The affected keys are:

 
{code:java}
google.auth.button.continue
microsoft.auth.button.continue
apple.auth.button.continue
slack.auth.button.continue{code}
 

English source:

[https://id.atlassian.com/login]

!image-2021-05-20-15-39-11-435.png|width=386,height=614!

[https://id.atlassian.com/signup] (side note: the wording is intentionally 'continue' not 'login' or 'signup' as these buttons are also used for migrations, invitations, etc).

!image-2021-05-20-15-40-56-581.png|width=385,height=657!

KIRBY ticket: [https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/KIRBY-2089]
fields.summary: Inconsistent wording for social login/signup buttons in some languages

Customer raised an issue with regard to cancelling their cloud site through the dutch version of our cancellation page. As per the customer, "This is the dutch version of the cancellation page. As you can see, it requests the word 'ANNULEREN' to be put in. This doesn't do anything, it does not make a new page available.
I entered 'CANCEL' instead, which brought me to the next page and allowed me to cancel.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Filter, it's hard to choose some of the export options due to the text truncation:

* RSSのエクスポート（コメント...
* Excel CSVをエクスポート（すべ...
* Excel CSVをエクスポート（現在..

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-26 at 19.55.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

* Widen the popup area, or
* Show a hover tooltip on each option

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Some of the export options are truncated

fields.description:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76481

 
h3. Problem

The German translation for "Hide finished tickets" is incorrect in Epic ticket issue view filter. See attached screenshot.
Currently it says "Ausblenden fertig", but this is incorrect (meaning "Hiding is complete").
The correct translation is "Fertige ausblenden" (meaning "Hide finished tickets")
h3. Environment

JS boards
.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Set profile language to german
Create an Epic and associate tasks.
View the epic and to the right side of the tasks, click the ... button which will show the filter Hide done.
h3. Expected Results

Hide done to Fertige ausblenden
h3. Actual Results

Hide done to Ausblenden fertig
h3. Workaround

_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation for 'Hide finished' filter in Epic

fields.description:
In Confluence Admin Area/Manage Apps the "Update" button is translated as "Zmeniť". The translation is completely wrong in this context. "Zmeniť" means "to change" more than "to update".

 

Please change the translation to "Aktualizovať". That will match the context.

 

In some contexts, "Update" could be translated to "Zmeniť", but not in this one.
fields.summary: Minor bugs in Slovak translation of Confluence

fields.description:
On the issue type page for next-gen projects, the "date and time" field type is translated without proper context.

Probably it was given for translation as "date and timestamp" (or something similar).

Stamp in PT-BR is translated as "carimbo" (like this: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rubber_stamp),] which doesn't make any sense in this context.

The accurate translation should be "Data e hora".

!image-2021-04-15-10-57-26-189.png!
fields.summary: Timestamp is mistranslated for PT-BR

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Redundant percentage prefix and suffix appear in the translated UI text:

* CURRENT_DATETIME
* CURRENT_USER

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-14 at 17.53.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Workflows* > *Post Fuctions* > *Add post function*
# Select *Update Issue Custom Field*

h3. Expected Results

{code:none}
%%CURRENT_USER%%
%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The below texts are rendered:

{code:none}
%%%%CURRENT_USER%%%%
%%%%CURRENT_DATETIME%%%%
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Redundant percentage prefix and suffix

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The due date field shows different translations when Jira is set to Spanish.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Personal Settings, change the language to "Spanish"
 # Go to the search results and add the column "Due date"
 # Move the cursor over "Fecha de Entrega"

!image-2021-04-08-10-59-18-761.png|width=757,height=196!
h3. Expected Results

Both field names should be the same: "Fecha de vencimento"
h3. Actual Results

The column shows "Fecha de Entrega" and the alt text box shows "Fecha de vencimento", causing confusion.

From:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-76336
fields.summary: Due date field shows different translations when Jira is set to Spanish

fields.description:
In the Control Chart the median value is incorrectly translated, instead of "médiane" we see "moyen".

Translation for median shows "médiane" and "moyen" however this is  math and the translation in French of the statistical value Median is "Mediane"
fields.summary: Wrong translation to French for "median"

fields.description:
The translation of "estimate" into Dutch currently is "schatten". This is confusing because I think "estimate" in this context is a noun and "schatten" is the verb "to estimate", although the noun "schatten" also exists which means "treasures". A better translation would be "schatting".

!image-2021-04-06-17-27-34-993.png!
fields.summary: Translation of "Estimate" into Dutch is confusing

fields.description:
The {{Russian}} Translation and its grammar are incorrect for the notification settings options under *Personal Settings* in Jira which is "You make changes to the Issue".


 * *Currently, we display:*
  "Вы вношу изменения для задачи" which according to Google Translate shows "You make changes for the task"

 * *Customers Feeback/Suggestion on Changing it to:*
  "Вы вносите изменения для задачи" which according to Google Translate shows "You are making changes for a task"

 * *Our suggestion on the same:*
  "Вы вносите изменения в Задачу" which according to Google Translate shows "You make changes to the Task"
fields.summary: Russian Translation of "You Make Changes to the Issue/Task" Option in Personal Settings Page of Jira.

Could you help us, please?

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Translate dates to Portuguese format (dd/MM/yyyy)

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
This is a regression bug for the previous related bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/I18N-3047, where customer found the translation of a Korean character is incorrect in the Email notification from Team Calendar.
(i) It was previously being logged for Confluence Team Calendar version 6.0.27 and 6.0.48, but we're seeing the exact same issue in version 7.0.7.

The translation of Korean is located in the below file:

team-calendars-7.0.7.jar/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/calendar3/calendar3_ko_KR.properties
And the translation of the title is the following:

calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\ud300 \uce98\ub9b0\ub354 {color:red}\ubc00{color}\ub9ac \uc54c\ub9bc
(!) The translation of \uBC00 (밀) should be changed to \uBBF8 (미).

h2. Steps to Reproduce
Create an email notification and check the title of notification containing typo.


h2. Expected Results
Korean: 팀 캘린더 미리 알림
Unicode Translation:
calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\uD300 \uCE98\uB9B0\uB354 \uBBF8\uB9AC \uC54C\uB9BC

h2. Actual Results
Korean: 팀 캘린더 밀리 알림
Unicode Translation:
calendar3.notification.reminder.title=\uD300 \uCE98\uB9B0\uB354 \uBC00\uB9AC \uC54C\uB9BC
fields.summary: A Korean translation on Email notification from Team Calendar is incorrect

fields.description:
admin.atlassian.com -> Security -> Overview

The "plan" in the header is a noun that is showing which plan the product is in(Free, Standard, Premium, Enterprise), however it is translated as a verb.
fields.summary: Mistranslation for "plan"

fields.description:
In concurrent editing mode the following message is shown in dutch: 

"gebruiker heeft wijzigingen aangebracht die niet gepubliceerd zijn."

What is the original English message?

We experienced that changes were saved. 

Either the translation is wrong or the concurrent editing function is failing.
fields.summary: Wrong message by editing page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The respective text generated when clicking on the stars is incorrect for Icelandic translation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Icelandic Language support to a Jira Service Management project
 # Enable Customer Satisfaction.
 # Create a ticket and close it so that a survey is triggered.

h3. Expected Results

*The text _Very Poor, Poor, Average, Good, Very Good_ should translate to _"Mjög slæm", "Slæm", "Miðlungs", "Góð", and "Mjög góð"_*

*Then when we click on 4 or 5 stars and get forwarded to the browser page for survey comments. It should translate to:*
{quote}"Frábært! Við höfum móttekið stjörnugjöfina.
 Ef þú átt lausa stund máttu skrifa nánari lýsingu svo við getum haldið þessu áfram!
 Valfrjáls athugasemd
 Bæta við athugasemd"
{quote}
*Clicking on 1 or 2 stars we should get:*
{quote}"Leiðinlegt að heyra.
 Ef þú átt lausa stund máttu skrifa nánari lýsingu svo við getum gert betur næst.
 Valfrjáls athugasemd
 Bæta við athugasemd"
{quote}
*3 stars is basically the 4-5 stars header with the 1-2 stars subheader*
{quote}"Takk! Við höfum móttekið stjörnugjöfina.
 Ef þú átt lausa stund máttu skrifa nánari lýsingu svo við getum gert betur næst.
 Valfrjáls athugasemd
 Bæta við athugasemd"
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

*"How was our service for this request?"* translates to *"Hvernig fannst þér þjónustan?"*
 "Service" or "Þjónusta" in Icelandic is a female word.
{quote}the text under the stars in the survey we get:
 "Mjög slæmt", "Slæmt", "Meðaltal", "Gott", and "Mjög gott".
 These are all gender neutral descriptors when they should be female to describe the female "Þjónusta".
{quote}
*When we click on 4 or 5 stars and get forwarded to the browser page for survey comments.*
{quote}In english it is:
 "Awesome! We got it.
 If you have a moment, tell us how it went so we can keep it up!
 Optional comment
 Add a comment"

and in Icelandic the current translation is
 "Æðislegur! Við náðum því.
 Ef þú átt lausa stund máttu segja okkur hvernig þetta gekk svo við getum haldið áfram!
 Valfrjálst athugasemd
 Bæta við athugasemd"
{quote}
Clicking on 1 or 2 stars we get in english:
{quote}"Sorry to hear that.
 If you have a moment, tell us how it went so we can do better next time.
 Optional comment
 Add a comment"

In icelandic we get:
 "En leiðinlegt.
 Ef þú átt lausa stund máttu segja okkur hvernig þetta gekk svo við getum staðið okkur betur næst.
 Valfrjálst athugasemd
 Bæta við athugasemd"
{quote}
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Icelandic translation on CSAT Feedback page incorrect.

fields.description:
Under "Accessibility"

Text: Background in subtle buttons

Key: jira.a11y.personal.settings.background-subtle-buttons.description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Message related to pages and Blog post under watches in user profile has additional symbol when language set to Danish

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to profile icon
 * Click on settings
 * Change the language to Danish
 * Click on Watches Tab
 * Message related to pages and Blog post under watches in user profile has additional symbol when language set to Danish
 
h3. Expected Results
Message related to pages and Blog post under watches in user profile should not have additional symbol. The issue does not appear with Language set to English (US/UK)


h3. Actual Results
Message related to pages and Blog post under watches in user profile has additional symbol when language set to Danish as follows:
{code}
For at følge sider eller blogindlæg i rum, skal du klikke på ‘Sider’ eller ‘Blog’ i rummets sidebjælke
{code}
fields.summary: Message related to pages and Blog post under watches in user profile has additional symbol when language set to Danish

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

The language preference set in *id.atlassian.com* is not respected at the sidebar and the top navbar on *admin.atlassian.com*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences and set the language as something other than English
 # Purge the client cache and reload the page (use the *Empty Cache and Hard Reload* feature on Chrome)
 # Wait for several minutes and access *admin.atlassian.com*

h3. Expected Results
*admin.atlassian.com* is loaded in the language set in 1.

h3. Actual Results
*admin.atlassian.com* is loaded in English. Confirmed setting Japanese and French:

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-12 at 11.32.30.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-12 at 11.41.55.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Lanuage configuration is partially ignored on admin.atlassian.com

fields.description: xxxx
fields.summary: xxxx
